data.enText: something that you want to do or achieve very much

data.chText: 她一直未能实现当名作家的夙愿。
data.enText: She never achieved her ambition of becoming a famous writer.
His burning ambition was to study medicine.

data.chText: 这是她终身追求的目标。
data.enText: It had been her lifelong ambition .

data.chText: 政治抱负；文学夙愿；运动目标

data.enText: the desire or determination to be successful, rich, powerful, etc.

data.chText: 她很聪明，但却缺乏远大志向。
data.enText: She was intelligent but suffered from a lack of ambition.

ex.chText: 他怀有自己经营公司的雄心壮志。
ex.enText: He has the great ambition of running a company on his own.

ex.chText: 他谋取高位的野心未能得逞。
ex.enText: His ambition of getting a higher position was not achieved.

synonyms.bx: 可用于褒义或贬义，常后接介词 of 或动词不定式。

ex.chText: 他完全不了解他们对未来的抱负。
ex.enText: He knew nothing about their aspirations for the future.
He has the aspiration to earn a lot of money.

synonyms.bx: 一般用复数，常含褒义，常后接介词 for 或动词不定式。

ex.chText: 她的伙伴们有强烈的获胜欲望。
ex.enText: Her partners have a strong desire to win.

ex.chText: 他们对知识的渴望深深地打动了那位老师。
ex.enText: The teacher was deeply touched by their desire for knowledge.
It was his desire that he should be buried in his hometown.

synonyms.bx: 一般指有强烈的目的和意图，常后接动词不定式、介词 for 以及 that 从句。

example: his ambition is to own his own business

value.def: If you have an ambition to do or achieve something, you want very much to do it or achieve it.

example.ex: His ambition is to sail round the world...
He harboured ambitions of becoming a Tory MP.
example.tran: 他梦想成为托利党下院议员。

value.def: Ambition is the desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.

example.ex: Even when I was young I never had any ambition.
example.tran: 即使是年轻时，我也从没有什么雄心壮志。
既野心勃勃又冷酷无情

trans: 金发雄心；金发野心；金发大志
